Images.Name: i0
Images.Description: Cell State Dependent Effects of Bmal1 on Melanoma Immunity and Tumorigenicity

Header:
Here we show six tissue cores from mouse melanoma tissues. The cores represent two replicate mice (columns) across three mouse lines (rows):  
1. wild-type Bmal1 (YUMM2.1-WT) - Middle Column  
2. a transcriptionally inactive Bmal1 mutant lacking the basic helix-loop-helix DNA binding domain (dHLH) (YUMM2.1-dHLH-Bmal1) - Right Column   
3. empty vector (YUMM2.1-EV) - Left Column  

Using multiplexed imaging, we found an increase in Sox9 and decrease in Sox10 expression in WT-Bmal1 tumors and in dHLH-Bmal1 expressing tumors, indicating a shift in cell lineage.  

### Attribution

Zhang et al., Cell State Dependent Effects of Bmal1 on Melanoma Immunity and Tumorigenicity. _Nature Communications_. 2023, [DOI: 10.1038/s41467-024-44778-2](https://doi.org/10.1038/s41467-024-44778-2).  

**Please cite this Minerva story as:**

### Experimental Details  
**Mouse background:** C57BL/6  
**Mouse Tumor Line:** YUMM2.1  

## Imaging  
**Assay:** CyCIF  
**Fixative Type:** Formalin  
**Microscope:** CyteFinder II HT  
**Objective:** 20X/0.75 NA  

### Associated Identifiers  
**LSP slide ID:** LSP12583

Waypoints.Name: Lineage switch in dHLH-Bmal1
Waypoints.Description: Over-expressed wildtype or a transcriptionally inactive mutant Bmal1 shifts YUMM 2.1 cells from a Sox10-high to a Sox9-high immune-resistant, mesenchymal cell state that is found in human melanomas.

Waypoints.Name: Ki67 in SOX10-high cells
Waypoints.Description:
YUMM2.1-WT tumors grew faster than the YUMM2.1-dHLH tumors, which are more anti-PD1 resistant. 

The percentage of Ki67+ melanoma cells (Sox9+ or Sox10+ cells) was lower in YUMM2.1-dHLH compared to YUMM2.1-WT tumors, which correlated with the slower growth rates of the YUMM2.1-dHLH tumors.
